thread.title: One of the region's top chefs adopts a school! | Anglia
thread.title_full: One of the region's top chefs adopts a school! | Anglia - ITV News

author: itv.com
title: One of the region's top chefs adopts a school! | Anglia
text:
Click here to see a report by ITV Anglia's Natalie Gray.
Play video One of the region's top chefs has adopted a school to share his passion for food.
Richard Hughes, who is Chef Director of The Assembly House in Norwich, is supporting National Adopt a School week, organised by the Royal Academy of Culinary Arts.
It is a charity that tries to encourage health eating and tackle obesity in children through education. Trained professional chefs and restaurant managers volunteer their time and expertise.
Chef Richard Hughes holds a bread-making master class. Credit: ITV Anglia Mr Hughes has adopted Browick Road Primary School in Wymondham and has been showing pupils a new baking skill.
"We've made bread today so we've done a bit of chemistry, we've done a bit of tasting, they've actually got their hands stuck in and the thing about cooking is that children love it so much, they'll eat this now within the hour, something really to be proud of."
â€“ Richard Hughes, Chef director, The Assembly House, Norwich. Last updated Tue 7 Feb 2017 Education chef Norfolk
